title: A Large Investor’s View of the Role of Sustainability
sub_head: KKR’s Elizabeth Seeger talks about the challenges of collecting—and understanding—ESG data
body:
Environmental, social, and governance issues make things a lot more complex for companies—and for the companies that invest in them.
To examine the questions and obstacles facing investment firms during the push for new ESG standards, The Wall Street Journal’s Laura Cooper spoke with Elizabeth Seeger, managing director of sustainable investing for KKR, at the WSJ Pro Sustainable Business Forum. Here are edited excerpts of the discussion.
